result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anton Depaul Williams

records.addlTxt:
10:47 AM Defendant Anton Depaul Williams not in court, in custody.  Attorney William Robert Kerner appeared by video for Anton Depaul Williams.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anton Depaul Williams appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William Robert Kerner in court for Anton Depaul Williams.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant. Defense counsel requests pretrial conference date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Adam Kerner in court, defendant Anton Depaul Williams not in court, in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for arraignment hearing. Defendant was transported to MSDF and was not produced for today's proceedings. Court adjourns case for defendant to be produced. Case adjourned to Branch 35 IN PERSON.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Arraignment scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anton Depaul Williams in court with attorney William Robert Kerner.  Defendant Anton Depaul Williams in custody.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: Officer Jonathan Schroeder (MPD). State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense counsel requests an arraignment date. Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Arraignment scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 057085,
Payable Number: 1014234,
Receipt Number: 22RP024644,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with N.A.S.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Anton Depaul Williams in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Anton Depaul Williams in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
